result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Jones, Raymond Nmi
defendant.address: P.O. Box 900, c/o Columbia Correctional Institute, Portage, WI 53901

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that the petition for review is summarily dismissed. No costs.
Request for release on signature bond pending appeal is denied.

It is ordered that the motion is denied. The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged.

It is further ordered the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis Stat 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a writ of habeas corpus, request for an investigation, and request for a copy of the defense witness list are all denied
It is ordered that the Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, request for an investigation, and request for a copy of the defense witness list are all denied.

It is ordered that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.
Acknowledgement of Filing of Writ of Habeas Corpus

records.addlTxt: Defendant Raymond Nmi Jones in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Defendant Raymond Nmi Jones in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:22 PM. DeBord has received PSI and has gone over it with the defendant and are prepared to proceed to sentencing. State is prepared to proceed to sentencing. Victim is in the courtroom and may like to make a statement. Court - sometime before State is concluded the defendant may make a statement if he so wishes. Defense not presenting any witnesses, confirms that the PSI is accurate and instructs Court that they have received the letters of support that were referenced in the PSI. State offers 8 exhibits that were pre-marked and gives to Court along with hand written statement of the victim. Court receives all 8 exhibits after no objection (1:27 PM). State recitets his closing argument from the JT and then begins argument for his sentence recommendation (1:27 PM) - recommends the following: count #6 - 37 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 27 years of initial confinement followed by 10 years of ES; count #1 - 12 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 7 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to count #6; #2 - 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to count #6; #3 - 9 months in jail to be served in prison setting - concurrent to count #6; #4 - 9 months in jail to be served in prison setting - concurrent to count #6; #5 - 25 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 15 years of initial confinement followed by 10 years of ES - concurrent to count #6; #7 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years in the WI State Prison System followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to count #6; #8 - 90 days jail - to be served in prison system - concurrent to count #6 - makes argument for his recommendation. State reads statement written by the victim (1:56 PM) - provides letter to Court. DeBord begins his sentence recommendation - recommends 30 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 10 years of initial confinement followed by 20 years of ES with 540 days credit and broken down by counts #1, #2, #3 , #4, #7 and #8 - #5 - 10 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 10 years of initial confinement followed by 10 years of ES - concurrent to all other counts; count #6 - 30 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 10 years of initial confinement followed by 20 years of ES, concurrent to all other counts. Jones makes statement (2:08 PM). Court begins sentencing - count #6 - 40 with 24 in and 16 out; #5 - 20 years with 12 in and 8 out - concurrent to count #6; #1 - 10 years witn 5 in and 5 out - concurrent to counts #6 and #5; #2 - 6 years with 3 in and 3 out - concurrent to other counts; #3 and #4 - 9 months in FC jail - concurrent to each other and other counts; #7 - 4 years with 2 in and 2 out - concurrent to other counts, #10 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to all other counts; conditions of ES - court costs on each count. State - restitution - $40,000.00 plus $4000.00 VW surcharge - joint and several with 14CF32 - asks that any prison funds be used to pay this. DeBord - restitution - no comment. Court - orders restitution joint and several with 14CF32 for $44,000.00 (Including victim witness surcharge), credit for 540 days, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, submit DNA sample, right to appeal.
from defendant requesting copy of jury instructions

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Count #3 as Alleged - Guilty - signed by Foreperson
Count #2 as alleged - Guilty - signed by Jury Foreperson
Count #1 as alleged - Guilty - signed by Jury Foreperson

Called at 9:11 AM. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with counsel Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. Jurors are not present. Discussion on jury instructions. Counsel agrees with the instruction for the lesser included offense on one of the counts but not the kidnapping count. Court has prepared the instructions along with the general instructions. Instructions: 100, 103, 140, 145, 147, 148, 157, 190, 195, 200, 300, 400, amended count #1 instruction, 1281, 112 for count #3, 160, 460, 515, plus verdict forms, 170 - discussion on this instruction. Counsel - no objections to instructions as stated. Recess at 9:30 AM to review verdict forms. Back on record at 9:48 AM, jurors not present. Counsel has no objections to jury instructions as prepared and verdict forms as prepared, all exhibits offered are received, discussion on Bey's telephone and State will instruct jury on that. Jurors enter courtroom at 9:52 AM. Court instructs jury. State makes closing arguments (10:24 AM). Bennett objects - sidebar (10:52 AM). Court explains sidebar. Bennett objects - sidebar (10:58 AM). Jurors leave courtroom at 11:23 AM. Recess at 11:24 AM. Back on record at 11:38 AM, jurors not present. Jurors enter courtroom at 11:40 AM. Bennett gives closing arguments at 11:40 AM. State objects - Court rules for State (11:51 AM). Re-buttal by State as 12:10 PM. Court gives final jury instructions at 12:28 PM. Bailiffs sworn in at 12:33 PM. Jurors begin deliberations and leave courtroom at 12:33 PM. Court directs two alternate jurors that were selected and are excused as jurors. No exhibits at this point going to the jury. Back on recorrd at 12:54 PM without defendant or jurors present. Jury wants to see two exhibits - no objections by counsel. Court will allow both exhibits (9 and 19). Recess at 1:00 PM. Recalled at 2:08 PM, no jurors present. Jurors enter courtroom at 2:09 PM. Foreperson states that the jury has reached the verdict and provides it to the Court. Court reviews verdict forms. Court reads verdicts - #1 - G as charged; #2 -  G as charged; #3 - G as charged. Court polls jury - all jurors answered yes when polled. Court thanks jurors and instructs them regarding their duty as jurors. Jurors leave courtroom at 2:13 PM. Bennett - no reasons to not enter verdicts. State - no reasons to not enter verdicts. Court enters verdicts and adjudges the defendant G of all three counts pursuant to the verdicts. State - remanded to FOSO until sentencing and revoke any bond posted. Court orders PSI, set for sentencing hearing at 3:00 PM on 8/11/15.

Continued - recalled 1:14 pm. Jurors are not present. All others present. Informal discussion on witnesses left. State is asking for short recess after 1st witness to get victim up here. State will be asking victim to remove his shoe while on the stand. Bennett objects for stated reasons. Court responds clarification. Court victim can testify to injuries however, will not be able to remove shoe. State asking that Mr Branam restraints be removed court defers to sheriff's judgment. Mr Branam's restraints are removed. 1:24 pm jurors return to courtroom. 1:24 pm James Branam sworn and direct by the state. State offers ex 50 (Branam video) court receives 1:28 pm video is played. Stopped video at 41:15. Cross exam by Bennett at 2:10 PM. Jurors have no questions. James Branam excused and released from subpoena obligations. Recess at 2:17 PM. Jurors leave courtroom. Back on record at 2:33 PM. Jurors not present at this time. Jurors enter courtroom at 2:34 PM. State calls S.R. Jr. SR sworn in. Direct exam by State at 2:35 PM. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (2:39 PM). State plays video that was stipulated to -  exhibit #51 and #52 - video of interview with SR. Court receives exhibits #51 and #52 after no objections (2:41 PM). State plays exhibit #51 first. Entire video of 31.51 played. State plays exhibit #52 - #2MOV - State stops DVD at 12:18. Bennett objects - leading - overruled (3:26 PM).  Bennett cross 3:45 pm. State - objection, clarify (3:52 pm).  State - objection, withdraws objection (4:01 pm). One juror has question of witness (4:20 pm).  Court asks the witness the jurors question.(4:24 pm). Bennett recross on the juror question. Witness excused 4:25 pm. State rests except for rebuttal. 4:26 pm record reflect jurors are not present. Bennett indicates who he plans on calling as witnesses. Bennett requests dismissal for stated reasons as state has not met burden of proof. Court responds 4:29 pm. Motion is denied for dismissal for stated reasons (4:32 pm). Court goes thru collquey regarding his constitutional rights regarding remaining silent or testifying. Jones understands, however asks for moment to discuss with attorney - court grants -  (4:37 pm) Jones indicates that he will not testify. Court finds defendant is excersing his right to remain silent and is knowingly and voluntarily doing so. 4:49 pm court recesses. 4:51 pm back on record - 4:53 pm record reflect jurors all present. Bennett calls April Jones sworn & direct 4:54 pm. State objects - no ruling Bennett to continue and be more specific with questions. State objection (hearsay) sustained (5:13 pm)  Bennett requests sidebar (5:14 pm) Bennett continues (5:15 pm)  State requests sidebar (5:27 pm) State cross (5:29 pm)  Bennett objection (speculative) sustained (5:33 pm) Bennett objection overruled (5:36 pm). Court requests sidebar (5:42 pm) Juror question (5:44 pm) Court asks the jurors question (5:45 pm) Bennett redirect 5:46 pm - State recross 5:47 pm Bennett objection (overruled) 5:47 pm. Bennett objection sustained (5:47 pm) Witness is excused 5:47 pm. Bennett asks for April Jones to be released from subpoena. 5:50 pm jurors leave the courtroom. 5:50 pm court addresses the sidebar - both parties agree with the reccessation of what happened with the sidebars. Recess 5:52 pm. Recalled 6:36 pm jurors not present - all others present - ex # 9 (map) is marked and received by court 6:37 pm. Record reflect jurors are now present 6:38 pm. Bennett calls Investigator AK sworn and direct 6:39 pm. State objection (relevance) sustained (6:46 pm) State objection (phrasing of question) court clarifies of the witness sustained (6:48). State objection (relevance) Bennett responds - sustained (6:49 pm). State objection sustained 7:01 pm. State cross 7:06 pm. Bennett object overruled (7:09 pm). No questions from the jurors. Bennett redirect 7:13 pm. State objection (beyond the scope) overruled (7:14 pm). State objection sustained (7:15 pm). State re-cross 7:16 pm. Witness excused 7;16 pm. Bennett rests 7;16 pm. State will not have any rebuttal/witnesses. Court instructs jury that concludes testimony and explains process from here on. Jurors are to report at 9 am. Attorney's and other personnel will report at 8:15 am tomorrow. Reminds jurors not to discuss the case with anyone or investigate by any means. Jurors excused 7:19 pm. Adjourned 7:20 pm.

Called at 8:18 AM. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. Jurors not present. Court - discussion on telephonic testimony for one of the defendant's witnesses. Bennett explains. State responds. Court will grant the telephonic appearance of defense witness D.P. State - discussion on playing video of taped interview with the victim - 28 minutes. Bennett responds - stipulates to the 28 minutes of the video to be played. Court will allow the video to be played. Defense is stipulating to the foundation of the DVD's. Court instructs counsel on time frames of testimony/closing/deliberation. Recess at 8:33 AM. Back on record at 8:39 AM, jurors not present. Jurors enter courtroom at 8:41 AM. Court instructs jury on timeline expectations. Justin Bey re-takes stand and is sworn in at 8:43 AM. Direct exam continued by State. Cross exam by Bennett at 9:10 AM. State objects - argumentative - sustained (10:03 AM). Jurors (4) have questions. Sidebar on first juror question. Court not allowing first juror question. Court allows section question. Court allows second juror question. Court allows third question. Recess for 10 minutes (10:24 AM). Back on record at 10:40 AM, jurors not present. Jurors enter courtroom at 10:42 AM. State offers exhibit #46 - transcript of Bey's interview of 3/13/14. Re-cross by Bennett at 11:02 AM. Bey excused at 11:05 AM. State calls Deputy John Thornton. Thornton sworn in at 11:06 AM. Direct exam by State. Court receives exhibit #46 after no objections (11:06 AM). State offers exhibit #47 - body camera of Officer Thornton. State starts tape at 1:30 and stops at 2:45. Cross exam by Bennett at 11:22 AM. Jurors have no questions. Thornton excused at 11:24 AM and he is released from his subpoena duties. Defense will be calling Dawn Pantoja but would like to call her now. State attemps to call Dawn Pantoja telephonically - got voicemail. Recess at 11:26 AM. Back on record at 11:29 AM. Dawn Pantoja now appears telephonically. Pantoja sworn in by Judge Bloom at 11:31 AM. Direct exam by State. State offers exhibit #48  - FOSO voluntary statement of witness and #49 - copies of text messages between Pantoja and Jones. Court receives exhibits #48 and #49 after no objections (11:33 AM). Cross exam by Bennett at 11:58 AM. State objects - withdraws objection for stated reasons (11:59 AM). Jurors have no questions. Re-drect by State at 12:08 PM. Pantoja excused at 12:09 PM and is released from her subpoena. Jurors excused for lunch at 12:09 PM. Court puts sidebar on the record. Counsel agrees to sidebar as stated on the record. Recess at 12:11 - back in seession at 1:10 PM.

Called at 8:37 AM. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody and with his attorney Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. Jury is not present at this time. Court - does miranda/goodchild collaquey. Bennett has no request for miranda/goodchild. State makes comment regarding portions of the video that are going to be played/skipped. Bennett responds. Discussion on Bennett's possible objections throughout the DVD. Off record at 8:42 AM to review transcripts of DVD. Back on record at 8:44 AM. Court - parties have agreed off the record to which parts of the DVD/transcript will not be played. Court will advise the jurors as to why part of the DVD will not be played. Jurors enter courtroom at 8:47 AM. Court addresses jurors. State calls Captain Jeff Marvin. Marvin sworn in at 8:50 AM. Direct exam by State. State offers exhibit #26. Court receives #36 after no objections (8:52 AM). Court reporter will not need to record the video that is going to be played. State starts DVD at 8:54 AM. State stops recording at 23:01 minutes (9:19 AM). Jurors leave courtroom at 9:19 AM. Bennett makes argument and requests mis-trial for stated reasons. State objects for stated reasons. Bennett responds. Court makes ruling - denies request for mis-trial and objectivity to this portion of the recording is overruled. Jurors re-enter courtroom at 9:29 AM. State continues recording at 9:29 AM. State stops and advances DVD as stipulated and restarts at 48:55 (9:51 AM). Jurors excused to get additional DVD set up. (9:58 AM). State - asks Court to direct clerk to review minutes in CCAP. State - Burns (counsel for one of the children) is requesting immunity for the children and State has no objections to that. Court will grant use-immunity to both children pursuant to statute. Burns makes statement. State agrees that any testimony given by the children will not be used against them in any potential deliquency cases - blanket immunity with no reprocussions and no video or audio. Court grants requests. Recess at 10:05 AM. Back on record at 10:15 AM, jurors enter courtroom at 10:17 AM. State begins tape 2 and indicates that the clock starts at 0:00. State stops recording at 1:41 and resumes at 6:10. State stops recording at 15:08 and resumes at 17:25. State stops video at 25:20 and resumes at 28:35 and will play thru 29:22. Sidebar at 29:09. State restarts at 28:35 after sidebar and will be stopping at 29:22 and State will not play anymore from the DVD. State resumes direct exam of Marvin at 10:42 AM. Bennett objects - leading - sustained for stated reasons (10:45 AM). State offers exhibit #29 - transcript of 3/13/14 interview of the defendant. Court does not need to receive the transcript for the purposes of its use. Bennett objects - hearsay and asks testimony to be stricken - overruled (10:58 AM). Cross exam by Bennett at 11:04 AM. State objects - sustained (11:05 AM). State objects - specicifity - re-stated (11:08 AM). State objects - sustained if question can be answered (11:12 AM). No jurors have questions. Redirect by State at 11:16 AM. Bennett objects - facts not in evidence/mischaracterization of evidence - withdraws question (11:17 AM). Marvin excused at 11:23 AM. State calls Melinda Chaney. Chaney sworn in at 11:26 AM. Direct exam by State. State offers exhibit #38 - EMS run sheet. Court receives exhibit #38 after objection overruled (11:29 AM). State offers exhibit #39 - enlargement of page 3 of run sheet. Court receives exhibit #39 after no objections (11:36 AM). No cross exam. Jurors have no questions. Chaney excused at 11:40 AM and is released from any subpoena obligations after no objections (11:40). State calls Dr. Lynn Gehrmann. Gehrmann sworn in at 11:43 AM. Direct exam by State. State offers exhibit #40 - Dr. Gehrmann's evaluation of victim. Cross exam by Bennett (11:59 AM). State objects - relevance - overruled (12:01 PM). State objects - overruled (12:04 PM). One juror has a question. Court allows question. No direct by State on that question/answer. Bennett cross exam on that question. State has one direct. Nothing further from defense. Dr. Gehrmann excused at 12:09 PM and is released from her subpoena. Court does not receive exhibit #40 for stated reasons.  Jurors excused for lunch at 12:11 PM - be back in jury room by 1:25 PM. Bennett brings up status of exhibit #37. Court has not received it yet, State does not want it to go to the jury for stated reasons. Court will take that issue up upon receipt or non-receipt of it. Bennett puts sidebar on the record. State and Court agree. State updates Court on witnesses. Bennett updates court on witnesses and asks for one of his witnesses to testify telephonically for stated reasons. State responds with its request in records to telephonic testimony. Court takes under advisement for now. Recess at 12:15 PM. Recalled at 1:42 PM, nothing needs to be addressed prior to jurors entering courtroom. Jurors enter courtroom at 1:55 PM. State calls Dr. Ivan L. Maldonado. Direct exam by State at 1:45 PM. Bennett objects - State restates question. Bennett objects - overruled (1:59 PM). State offers exhibit #41 - Dr. Maldonado's report. Bennett objects - sustained (2:14 PM). Cross exam by Bennett at 2:20 PM. Dr. Maldonado excused at 2:26 PM and is released from his subpoena. Bennett requests that exhibit #41 be received. State responds with approach to admitting exhibit #41. Court will not formally receive exhibit #41 at this point. State calls MC. Bennett wants to be heard outside the presence of the jury regarding this witness. Jurors leave courtroom at 2:27 PM. Bennett renews its objection to MC being called by State. State responds - objects to Bennett's objections for stated reasons. Court makes ruling - denies Bennett's objection and will allow MC to testify. Court instructs TV station. TV crew makes statement regarding their intent. Court - No visual or audio broadcast is allowed of the children. TV crew makes clarification. Court responds - everyone is clear.  Defendant also warns defendant. State calls MC. MC sworn in at 2:44 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Bennett at 2:55 PM. Jurors do not have any questions. State has re-diect at 2:59 PM. MC excused at 2:59 PM and is released from his subpoena obligations. State calls SJ. Defense renews its objections for next witness (SJ) called by State. State - reponse re-newed. Court so notes. SJ sworn in at 3:01 PM. Direct exam by State. Bennett objects - asked and answered - question allowed (3:07 PM). Cross exam by Bennett at 3:11 PM. Jurors have no questions. No re-direct. SJ excused at 3:17 PM and releaed from her subpoena. State calls Brian Shicks. Shicks sworn in at 3:18 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. State offers exhibit #42 - screen shots of text messages between witness and defendant. Court receives exhibit #42 after no objections (3:22 PM). Recess at 3:28 PM. Back on record at 3:35 PM. State offers exhibit #43 - continued text messages between witness and defendant. Court receives exhibit #43 after no objections (3:36 PM). Cross exam by Bennett at 3:40 PM. Jurors have no questions of witness. Re-direct by State (3:43 PM). Shicks excused at 3:44 PM and is released from his subpoena. State calls Lisa Shaw (Wyatt). Direct exam by State at 3:46 PM. State offers exhibit #44 - letter from Shaw to investigating officer. State objects - hearsay - sustained (3:52 PM). Cross exam by Bennett at 3:53 PM. Bennett marks exhibit #45 - facebook conversation between Shaw (Wyatt) and A. Jones. State objects - hearsay - sustained (3:57 PM). State objects - relevance - sidebar - sustained after sidebar (3:59 PM). Jurors have no questions. Shaw (Wyatt) excused but is not yet from her subpoena obligations for stated reasons (4:01 PM). Jurors leave courtroom at 4:02 PM. Court puts sidebar on the record - agreed by counsel as stated on the record. Discussion on telephonic rebuttal witness testimony of Shaw (Wyatt). Court will release Shaw (Wyatt) from her subpoena duties. Recess at 4:08 PM for 10 minutes. Back on record at 4:20 PM without jurors present. State calls Justin Bey. Bey sworn in at 4:21 PM. Court does collaquey with defendant regarding testifying today and instructs on rights under 5th and 6th amendments. Bey will testify today truthfully. State has nothing further regarding Bey's testimony/rights. Bennett has nothing further regarding Bey's testimony/rights. Court responds. All parties understand. Back on record at 4:30 PM. Jurors enter courtroom at 4:32 PM. Justin Bey sworn in again at 4:32 PM. Direct exam by State. Bennett objects - speculation - question re-phrased (4:50 PM). Bennett objects - speculation - sustained (4:50 PM). Bennett objects - hearsay - overruled (4:52 PM). State offers exhibit #19. Court receives after no objections (4:58 PM). State objects - hearsay - confine answers to Court's rulings (5:38 PM). Bennett objects - hearsay - overruled within context (5:39 PM). State objects - leading - answer can stand (5:39 PM). Recess at 5:59 PM. Back on record at 6:03 PM. Court adjourns for the day at 6:05 PM - gives collaquey to jurors regarding their duties. Jurors to report back at 8:30 AM, counsel to be ready to proceed by 8:15 AM. Jurors leave courtroom at 6:06 PM. State gives warning to witness regarding discussing case/testimony. Adjourned for the day at 6:07 PM.

#1 - head photo of victim; #2 - body photo of victim; #3 - photo of victim's left foot; #4 - photo of victim's left foot; #5 - photo of victim's right foot; #6 - photo of victim's big toe on right foot; #7 - photo of victim's big toe on right foot; #8 - photo of victim's knee; #9 - map; #10 - photo with bloody q-tip; #11 - photo of bloody snow; #12 - photo of Hemlock Lake sign; #13 - plowed are (view #1); #14 - plowed area (view #2); #15 - photo of bloody q-tip on ground; #16 - photo of leaves on ground with blood; #17 - photo of leaves on ground with blood; #18 - photo of leaves on ground with blood; #19 - floor plan of defendant's residence; #20 - photo of car interior with tampon; #21 - photo of car interior with blood; #22 - photo of blue/green car (LeSabre); #23 - rear door of defendant's residence; #24 - photo of cane in snow; #25 - view of snow out back door of defendant's residence; #26 - front of defendant's residence' #27 - photo of camouflage clothing; #28 - photo of bloody jeans; #29 - photo of lamp with handcuffs; #30 - photo of bathroom; #31 - photo of dresser with handcuffs; #32 - transmittal of crime evidence; #33 - receipt of physical evidence; #34 - evidence release form; #35 - DNA analysis; #36 - interview of Ray Jones (3/31/14); #37 - transcript of 3/31/14 interview; #38 - EMS run sheet; #39 - enlargement of EMS run sheet; #40 - medical notes of victim from Dr. Gehrmann; #41 - Report of Maldanado; #42 - photos of text messages; #43 - photo of continued text messages; #44 - letter from Lisa Wyatt/Shaw to FOSO; #45 - facebook shot of Wyatt/Shaw conversation; #46 - transcript of Bey interview (3/31/14); #47 - body camera of Officer Thornton; #48 - voluntary statement of Pantoja; #49 - photo of text message between Pantoja & Jones; #50 - CD of James Branam (3/28/14); #51 - transcript of Steven Roberts interview part #1; #52 - transcript of Steven Roberts interview part #2

JT continued 3:34 pm. State offers ex 12, 13, 14 & 15 as a published group after no objection from Bennett court receives all exhibits as a group 3:35 pm. Bennett objects sustained 3:36 pm Bennett no cross. No questions from the jurors. 3:41 pm witness excused. State calls Deputy SA sworn and direct 3:42 pm. Bennett objects hearsay - state information gathering - court sustained 3:48 pm. Witness identifies defendant 3:50 pm. Bennett cross 4:00 pm. State objects relevance - Bennett responds - Court overruled 4:04 pm. Jurors have no questions. State redirect 4:07 pm. Witness excused 4:10 pm. State asks for brief recess. Jurors excused from courtroom 4:12 pm. 4:30 pm jurors return to courtroom - Judge addresses the jurors regarding running late tonight and tomorrow night. State would like to release Deputy SA from his subpoena. Court releases Deputy SA from subpoena after no objection from defense. State calls Deputy AK sworn and direct 4:31 pm. Bennett objects spectulation - sustained 4:38 pm. State offers exhibits 20 (photo of inside of vehicle parked at Jones residence) after no objection court receives  4:42 pm - ex 21 (photo close up of same stain in vehicle parked at Jones residence) after no objection  court receives ex 21 4:43 pm - ex 22 ( photo teal vehicle owned by SM) after no objection court receives ex 22 4:44 pm - State moves to publish ex 20 -22 - no objection request granted 4:44 pm - state offers ex 23 (rear view of Jones residence w/small wooden object) ex 23 received 4:47 pm ex 24 (upclose picture of broken cane) received 4:47 pm ex 25 ( photo out the back of the house) received 4:47 pm ex 26 (view of residence where search warrant executed) received 4:48 pm State moves to publish exhibits 23 - 26 request granted 4:48 pm. State ex 27 (photo of kitchen area of Jones residence/camo clothing) received 4:51 pm - ex 28 (photo of jeans by washing machine in Jones res) received 4:51 pm ex 29 (photo of zip tie cuffs) received 4:52 pm - ex 30 (photo bathroom of residence) received 4:52 pm ex 31 (items on dresser in bedroom) received 4:53 pm - state moves to publish 27 - 31 request granted 4:53 pm. State offers ex 32 (transmittal of criminal evidence) received 4:58 pm ex 33 (receipt of criminal evidence) received 5:02 pm ex 34 (evidence release form) received 5:02 pm ex 35 (DNA report form/analysis) received 5:04 pm. Bennett objects relevance - state responds - overruled 5:06 pm. Bennett objects hearsay - sustained 5:10 pm. Bennett objects hearsay sustained 5:11 pm. Bennett cross 5:12 pm state objection (argumentative) sustained 5:15 - state objection (argumentative) court can answer question - Bennett plans on calling AK for rebuttal. Jurors no questions. Witness is excused 5:16 pm. Court reminds jurors not to discuss case with anyone, avoid news papers, etc. Jurors to reconvene at 8:15 am. Jurors excused 5:18 am. Adjourned 5:21 pm.

Called 8:16 am. In small court room with no jurors present. Attorney Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. Raymond Jones is not present at this time. Bennett makes statement will plea to 5 counts and only try remaining 3 counts and will enter pleas of no contest to the 5 counts. State responds still wants to present whole case for stated reasons. Counts 2, 3, 4, 7 & 8 would be what is pleading too. State only to argue to events of possibly 1 day/night. State disagrees with Bennett's recommendation of not presenting the whole case in its totallity. Court responds to both parties arguments. Bennett responds regarding evidence to be brought in asking for order to prohibit the humiliation of the defendant for stated reasons. Doesn't want the children's involvement brought into court for stated reasons. State responds to humiliation request believes it should be brought in - believes that the children do need to testify for stated reasons. Bennett responds to states arguement. Court responds to witness testifying (that the children could be called to testify no matter of law to not allow) for stated reasons - humiliation issue - Bennett willing to stipulate that defendant did have to clean with toothbrush. 8:36 am Raymond Jones is now present in courtroom/custody. State objects to stipulating. Court will allow the humiliation issue in for stated reasons. Discussion on children. Bennett wants clarification of states motion #6. State #6 doesn't apply to this case. State believes alternate jurors and no problem with jurors asking questions. Bennett responds agrees with state. Court will allow questions and note taking by the juror. State will stipulate to all prior convictions of the witnesses. 8:53 am brief recess to allow Bennett to speak to client. Discussion on jury selection 2 extra called to the box. Recalled 9:04 am. Same appearances. Court has plea questionnaire - counts 2, 3, 4, 7 & 8 defendant pleading NC. Bennett and Jones agree (both parties signed the questionnaire today). Jones pleads NC to counts 2, 3, 4, 7 & 8. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering his pleas to counts 2, 3, 4, 7 & 8 freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering his plea and waiving constitutional right to a JT, factual basis exists, accepts pleas and adjudges guility of counts 2, 3, 4, 7 & 8. Sentencing will be withheld until conclusion of jury trial on the remaining counts. State is moving to amend count 6 of the information (date Tuesday 3/11/14) Bennett agrees. State on counts that have already plead too. Court will not allow that defendant has plead to some of the counts. Bennett clarification no shackles in view of the jury - brought up in elevator and shackles removed prior to leaving elevator and asking that deputies stay off and attorney will be responsible for him. Court - remove shackles/handcuffs prior to coming onto 3rd floor - deputies to be mindful of their proximity of the defendant and it is up to sheriff discretion. Adjourned 9:16 am. Recalled 9:24 am. Same appearances. Bennett makes statement regarding Frye. State elaborates on Frye. Court goes over Frye with defendant. Bennett/Jones agrees that negotations have come to an end. All offers no longer valid once the jury is sworn. Jones understands and he is not accepting plea offers on the 3 counts and will continue to trial. Ajourned 9:29 am. Called at 9:34 AM. Court addresses jurors. Clerk swears jurors in at 9:38 AM. Voir dire begins at 9:41 AM. State introduces witnesses at 9:43 AM. Bennett introduces witnesses at 9:48 AM. Court begins its voir dire at 9:49 AM. State begins voir dire at 10:28 AM. Sidebar with counsel at 11:01 AM. Recess at 11:02 AM. Recalled at 11:07 AM with jurors present. Bennett begins voir dire at 11:08 AM. State objects - Court restructs question. Court interrupts Bennett's voir dire to explain juror's roles today (11:20 AM). Pre-empetory challenge at 11:30 AM. Jurors selected and sworn in at 11:45 AM. Jurors excused for lunch at 11:46 AM. State moves to sequestor witnesses. No objections by Bennett. Court orders sequestration of witnesses. Recess at 11:48 AM and reconvene at 1:00 PM. Recalled at 1:01 PM without jurors present. Court puts on record the side bars - Bennett and State agree that it was accurate as stated by Court. Jurors enter courtroom at 1:15 PM. Court gives preliminary instructions. State makes opening argument at 1:21 PM. Bennett makes opening argument at 1:45 PM. Witnesses suqeustored. State calls Matthew Maulson. Maulson sworn in at 1:48 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Bennett. Maulson excused and released from subpoena after no objections. State also releases Nicholas Zortman and Keith Allen. Court released those two witnesses after no objections. State calls Deputy Craig Justice. Justice sworn in at 1:52 PM. Direct exam by State. Jurors leave courtroom at 2:21 PM to have discussion without jurors present. Court sites statute and discussion regarding the admission of exhibit #1. Court finds no discovery issues and exhibit #1 will be admissable (2:29 PM). Jurors re-enter courtroom at 2:32 PM. Direct exam of Justice continues. Bennett objects - hearsay - sustained (2:34 PM). State offers exhibit #1 - picture of victim - head shot. Court receives exhibit #1. State publishes exhibit #1 to jury after allowed by Court. State offers exhibit #2 - picture of victim - body shot. Court receives exhibit #2. State publishes exhibit #2 to jury after allowed by Court. State offers exhibit #3 - picture of victim - foot shot (Left). Court receives exhibit #3. State publishes exhibit #3 to jury after allowed by Court. State offers exhibit #4 - picture of victim's left foot (different angle). Court receives exhibit #4. State publishes exhibit #4 to jury after allowed by Court. State offers exhibit #5 - picture of victim's right foot. Court receives exhibit #5. State publishes exhibit #5 to jury after allowed by Court. State offers exhibit #6 - picture of victim's right big toe. Court receives exhibit #6. State publishes exhibit #6 to jury after allowed by Court. Cross exam by Bennett at 2:43 PM. Bennett shows witness his (witness) police report. State objects - relevance - overruled (2:47 PM). No questions by jurors. Re-direct by State at 2:50 PM. Justice excused at 2:51 PM and asks that he be released from subpoena. Bennett may calls for rebuttal. Justice instructed to be available if needed. Recess for 10 minutes - jurors leave courtroom at 2:54 PM. No objections for Justice to remain in Courtroom and no longer sequestored. Court puts Bennett's objection to the receipt of exhibits. State - not offering exhibits #7 and #8. Recess at 2:55 PM. Jurors re-enter courtroom at 3:10 PM with same appearances. State calls Deputy Donald Belland. Belland sworn in at 3:11 PM. Direct exam by State. Bennett objects - calls for speculation - Court clarifies. State offers exhibit #9 - map of home of alleged crime - received after no objections. State offers exhibit #10 - picture of DNA swab of snow with blood. Court receives exhibit #10 after no objections (3:25 PM). State publishes exhibit #10 to jury after allowed by Court. State offers exhibit #11 - photo of bloody snow. Court receives exhibit #11 after no objections (3:27 PM).

Defendant Raymond Nmi Jones in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett who appears in person in Oneida County.  Defendant Raymond Nmi Jones in custody. Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:19 PM.  Judge Bloom appears telephonically from Oneida County. Bennett updates court on status of case - still set for trial but will be making an offer to DA, no more information in regards to NGI. Court responds - comply with NGI guidelines and time limes without interrupting the JT dates that are currently scheduled. Court continuse bond and JT is already set and will remain on the calendar as set. Nothing further from counsel or State. Adjourned at 1:23 PM.

Defendant Raymond Nmi Jones in court/custody via video with attorney Brian F. Bennett in person.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Bloom appears telephonically from Oneida County bench. Called 1:10 pm. Court reviews the status of case. Bennett makes statement negotations on going. Simono agrees that status conference would be appropriate - Bennett agrees. Set for STC and parties may appear telephonically.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Called at 1:38 PM. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Brian Bennett. State appears telephonically with leave of Court. Court appears telephonically from Oneida County. Court has received the metal competency report. Bennett and State have received a copy of the report as well. court - the evaluators report does not support a plea of NGI. Bennett is requesting an independent evaluation - asks for another PTC/STC about 6-8 weeks out to get independent evaluation completed. State responds - wants matter scheduled for JT for stated reasons. Court - set for status conference about 45 days out. State - would like permission to have his own independent evaluator as well. Bennett - no objections. Court will allow. Court continues bond, grants severance for purposes of trial, set for 4-day JT on 5/19 - 5/22/15 beginning at 8:30 AM, set for PTC on 1/16/15 at 1:00 P - telephonic for all parties.
Mental Health Evaluation - clerk provided copies to DA, Attorney Bennett and Judge Bloom.
Status conference on December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Nmi Jones in court/custody with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:09 pm. Judge Bloom appears via phone from Oneida County. Bennett not resolved. Bennett indicates that defendant is not getting his mail at the jail and may be filing motions regarding this as his client did not get the plea offer. Asking to change plea to NG by mental disease/defect and asks for appointment of competency for stated reasons. State responds no response to the change of plea or appointment of doctor and will look into the issue of Jones not getting his mail. Bennett responds. Court allows change of plea to NG by mental disease/defect and will appoint a doctor. Clerk to file paperwork to get assesstment. Back on record 2:22 pm. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Called at 1:59 PM. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. Bennett has filed a motion to sever defendants - states motion - also joins in the motion to enlarge time for filing of future motions for stated reasons. State has no objections to motion to sever. Court will grant the motion to sever defendants for stated reasons - encourages other defendants to file motion to sever as well. State would have no objections to any motions to sever defendants that may be filed on any of the cases. Future scheduling will be done with both JA's and Forest County COC, bond continued on this matter.
Defendant's in Support of Defendant's Motion to Sever Defendants

Called at 1:35 PM. Also called 14CF32, 14CF33, 14CF35 and 14CM81. April Jones appears in person and in custody with counsel Sheila Kessler. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with her counsel Brian Bennett. Justin Bey appears in person and in custody with counsel Michael Hughes. Samantha McClellan appears in person and with counsel Thomas McClure. Court has reviewed the motion that was filed by Attorney McClure for his client. All counsel ready to proceed to ARGN today, all counsel willing to waive reading of Information, all counsel pleads NG to all counts on all complaints. Kessler stands mute and asks court to enter NG plea on her behalf. Court does. State and counsel wish to schedule all matters for PTC, Bennett will be filing at least one motion prior to PTC and wishes to extend 10 day time limit for that, Kessler joins in on that statement as well. McClure wants his motion heard ASAP, other counsel OK with getting motion hearing date after PTC. Court sets 13CF35 for motion hearing on 6/3/14 at 3:00 PM and PTC on 7/28/14 at 3:00 PM, state to submit any responses 7 calendar days prior to 6/3/14, all other cases will be set for PTC on 7/28/14 at 1:30 PM, counsel to work with JA Shawl for motion hearing dates, court continues bond on all cases, grants extension of 10 day period time for filing motions, adjourned.
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: #1 - Sgt Ashbeck's report; #2 - Dr. Maldonado's report; #3 - Tonya Malone's statement

Called at 3:46 PM. Also called other co-defendants cases of 14CF32, 14CF33 and 14CF35. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison appearing specially for Brian Bennett; April Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Sheila Kessler; Justin Bey appears in person and in custody with attorney Michael Hughes and Samantha McClellan appears in person and with counsel Thomas McClure. State calling one witness out of order for stated reasons. State calls Dr. Ivan Maldonado. State will have to recall him later as he is not available. State now calls Deputy Steve Ashbeck. Ashbeck sworn in at 3:54 PM. Direct exam by State. State marks exhibit #1. Record reflects proper identification of defendant Justin Bey. State offers exhibit #1 (4:21 PM). Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (4:23 PM). Court reflects proper identification of defendant Raymond Jones. Court reflects proper identification of defendant April Jones. Record reflects proper identification of Samantha McClellan. Cross exam by Michael Hughes at 4:27 PM. State objects - relevance. Galen-Bayne Allison objects - relevance. Court sustains objections. Statre objects - relevance. Bayne-Allison - no foundation. Court sustains both objections. State objects - no reason. Court overrules. State objects - relevance - overruled. Cross exam by Sheila Kessler at 4:34 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 4:37 PM. Ashbeck steps down momentarily to contact another witness - Dr. Ivan Maldonado. State calls Dr. Maldonado sworn in at 4:40 PM. Direct exam by State. All counsel stipulates to Dr. Maldonado's qualifications. Kessler objects to the fact that the doctor may be testifying from medical records and they do not have copies of them for today's proceedings. Court instructs. Witness verifies. State asks the witness to only testify off the medical records from his facility and no other facilities. Court makes copies of these records for all counsel. Cross exam by Michael Hughes at 4:59 PM. The report that the doctor was referring to is marked as exhibit #2, received after no objectons (5:00 PM). State objects - relevance - sustained. No questions from Kessler or Bayne-Allison. Cross exam by McClure at 5:07 PM. Dr. Maldonado excused at 5:09 PM. Ashbeck retakes the stand at 5:09 PM, still under oath. No more questions by counsel. Ashbeck excused at 5:09 PM. State calls Lieutenant Karcz. Karcz sworn in at 5:10 PM. Direct exam by State. Court instructs all witness to not use childrens names during testimony (5:14 PM). Cross exam by Hughes at 5:29 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 5:31 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (5:32 PM). Karcz excused at 5:32 PM. State calls Captain Marvin. Marvin sworn in at 5:32 PM. Direct exam by State. McClure objects - sustained (5:43 PM). State marks exhibit #3 and offers exhibit #3 (5:46 PM). Court receives exhibit #3 after no objections (5:47 PM). Recess at 5:48 PM. Recalled at 5:59 PM. Direct exam continues. Cross exam by Hughes at 6:01 PM. State objects - relevance - overruled (6:02 PM). Cross exam by Kessler at 6:02 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 6:03 PM. Cross exam by McClure at 6:04 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (6:05 PM). Re-direct by State at 6:06 PM. Re-cross by McClure at 6:08 PM. Court has questions of witness. Re-direct by State at 6:10 PM. Marvin excused at 6:11 PM. State relies on testimony rather than further argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was commited by Justin Bey and Raymond Jones. State makes argument for Court to find probable cause on Samantha McClellan but willing to concede on April Jones for stated reasons. Kessler makes argument - does not believe State has met its burden at this point - asks for dismissal of felony counts. McClure makes argument - does not believe State has met its burden at this point - asks for dismissal of felony counts. State responds. McClure makes final rejoinder. State responds. Court makes ruling on McClellan and April Jones - finds probable cause that both these individiuals committed a felony - binds both over trial. Court continues bond on all defendants, set all matters for ARGN. Hughes files a joined defendants request for substitition of Judge on all cases. Court accepts request for substitution.

Called at 9:47 AM. Raymond Jones appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Brian Bennett appears in person. Jones makes statement regarding believes he should be appearing in person and not on video. Jones now agrees to appear by video but understands that the Court will bring him over in person if he would prefer. Jones will appear via video. Bennett has complaint, waives reading, set for PH, will waive time limits to 4/9/14. Court sets for PH on 4/9/14 at 3:00 PM. Bennett - bond - requests significant signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to any change in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - continues bond at this point.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 1:00 PM. Raymond Jones appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Court reads charge and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Jones provided with complaint at FOSO. Jones states he cannot afford his own attorney and will contact SPD. State - bond previously set at $100,000.00 cash and asks that it continue. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 3/26/14 at 9:00 AM. Jones makes statement, court clarifies.
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with victim. (Refused)
